alert.note: Alert for Cameron Island; Kenedy Island; Willacy Island (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued December 13 at 2:50PM CST until December 15 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT... * WHAT...For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents. For the Coastal Flood Statement, isolated minor coastal flooding expected this evening with water nearing the dune line at narrow beaches. * WHERE...Kenedy Island, Willacy Island and Cameron Island Counties. * WHEN...For the High Rip Current Risk, through Friday afternoon. For the Coastal Flood Statement, from 6 PM this evening to midnight CST tonight. * IMPACTS...Wave run-up may approach the dunes along narrow beaches. Beach equipment, such as umbrellas and chairs, could be moved by waves in these areas. Vehicles driving along narrow beaches may experience higher water levels. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...High tide along the Isla Blanca jetty on South Padre Island is at 729 PM. Continued easterly swell will push water toward the dunes at narrow beaches for a few hours after before receding overnight. Water is expected to reach into the dunes in some spots at high tide Thursday evening, and Coastal Flood Advisories are likely then.
info.instruction: If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline, then swim back to shore once out of the current. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help. Owners of beach equipment should stow the equipment or move behind the dune line to be safe. Drivers are recommended to not attempt driving the public access points tonight.

area.areaDesc: Cameron Island; Kenedy Island; Willacy Island
